43be21f7-64e4-44d4-8548-5259ceefc194.description: Graduates of this course are prepared to work in NATO and are familiar with the Interoperability requirements needed to ensure mission success in a multinational environment. Graduates of this course are versed with NATO structures, policies, operations, and current issues affecting the Alliance.
43be21f7-64e4-44d4-8548-5259ceefc194.name: M5-32 NATO Orientation Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M5-32 NATO Orientation Course have completed over 40 hours of study related to NATO's structure, policies, and operations.

5689aaa7-6593-45c4-8432-823615885911.description: By having completed this course the graduates are able to contribute to NATO’s operations planning process, either as an operational-level or functional-area planner, while serving within a joint operational-level headquarters, applying the principles of the Comprehensive Operations Planning Directive (COPD).
5689aaa7-6593-45c4-8432-823615885911.name: S5-54 NATO Comprehensive Operations Planning Course

badge_template_activities.title: Under the leadership of the lead facilitator and supported by a group of component liaison officers and functional area subject matter experts, this demanding and dynamic two-week course simulates a joint operational-level planning group. The curriculum is comprised of multiple short lectures, followed by practical exercises in sub-syndicates and back-briefs in syndicates (25% - 75%). Both weeks culminate in formal briefs to a senior mentor who performs the role of a joint commander.

8914be42-f8d8-4192-a46f-a9550f9d14fb.description: By having completed this course the graduate are able to understand an in-depth overview of the resource management process in a detailed manner via the concept of the Military Budget (MB), NATO Security Investment Program (NSIP), and manpower.
8914be42-f8d8-4192-a46f-a9550f9d14fb.name: M8-30 Resource Management Education Programme (RMEP) Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M8-30 Resource Management Education Programme (RMEP) Course have completed over 40 hours, comprised of several lectures building on the three pillars of RMEP. They also completed scenario-based syndicate exercises.

skills.name: NATO Political And Military Resource Structures

a2672761-f337-4a4d-8936-24d31b81fec2.description: Graduates of this course are certified to conduct combat readiness evaluations in land units and HQs as evaluators, evaluation team chiefs and NATO monitors. The course certificate certifies them to perform all the above tasks both in NATO and at national level.
a2672761-f337-4a4d-8936-24d31b81fec2.name: N3-24 ACO Combat Readiness Evaluation (CREVAL) Course for Land Forces

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the N3-24 NATO ACO Combat Readiness Evaluation (CREVAL) Course for Land Forces Course have succesfully completed over 40 hourse including  an e-learning module, attended lectures related to NATO's land evaluation policies, procedures and guidelines,  tasked with scenarios that implement all gained knowledge, and nave been formatively assessed.

3848fb1d-3a75-4442-a029-a73c2941d257.description: Graduates of this course are prepared to work in NATO in support of planning and executing the Information Knowledge Management functions and services. Graduates of this course are versed with NATO Information Management policies and guidelines and establishing procedures for continuous improvement that measurably improve efficiency of information management within NATO.
3848fb1d-3a75-4442-a029-a73c2941d257.name: P5-07 NATO Information Knowledge Management Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the P5-07 NATO Information Knowledge Management Course have completed over 40 hours of study related to NATO's Information Management policies and guidelines and the development of Information Management plans and processes to continuously increase efficacy and reduce suboptimal practices.

30c182cc-9b04-4bd3-a63b-182cc5dcfff5.description: Graduates of this course are provided with foundational knowledge of NATO logistics, policy, principles, concepts, and doctrine of theater-level logistics in operations.
30c182cc-9b04-4bd3-a63b-182cc5dcfff5.name: M4-159 NATO Logistics Introductory Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M4-159  NATO Logistics Introductory Course have completed over 40 hours comprised of lectures, syndicate work, and student presentations. Due to the huge amount of information, 80% of the course consists on central presentations/lectures held by a facilitating team (4-5 teachers/instructors). The syndicate work consists on analysis of the main logistic doctrines, discussions and back briefings having “understanding of the doctrine” as the main objective.

3b3ebe0b-7b93-4f10-8841-c510ae452eb1.description: Graduates of the M6-108 Network Security Course designed and conducted by Naval Postgraduate School at NSO have demonstrated in depth knowledge and skills of the bits-in-transit aspect of network security, including defining a network, exploring routers, routing & ACL basics, traffic analysis, perimeter defence & NIDS weaknesses, authentication, and virtual private networks.
3b3ebe0b-7b93-4f10-8841-c510ae452eb1.name: M6-108 Network Security Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M6-108 Network Security Course have completed over 120 hours to exercises, lectures, laboratories, quizzes, tests and discussions related to Network Security Challenges and Issues.

A final summative exam that demonstrates skill and knowledge is required. Students will be assessed based upon a combination of labs, on-line quizzes, and a final exam. The weight of these will be as follows: Labs: 25%; on-line weekly quizzes: 35%; a comprehensive final exam: 40%.

b6664cc3-5f08-422f-9d07-ba185b95546c.description: By having completed this course the graduate has demonstrated the ability to construct and deliver a lesson integrating effective instructional strategy and methods.
b6664cc3-5f08-422f-9d07-ba185b95546c.name: M7-98 NATO Instructor Course

alignments.name: The International Board of Standards for Training, Performance and Instruction (ibstpi®)
alignments.description: For more than three decades, The International Board of Standards for Training, Performance, and Instruction (ibstpi®) has been developing and validating the standards for professionals in the fields of training and performance. Our standards come as a result of a rigorous research process, development, international validation, and publication.

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M7-98 course have completed over 40 hours of study related to effective teaching methods and presentation techniques in the delivery of academic instruction. Students are assessed against instructor competencies outlined by the International board of standards for training, performance and instruction (IBSTPI)

cf36e0bb-0da5-4f8e-9d4b-31851ab947fe.description: Graduates of this course are prepared to work effectively within the Alliance and are familiar with NATO structures, policies, operations, and emerging issues required for Non-Commissioned Officers.
cf36e0bb-0da5-4f8e-9d4b-31851ab947fe.name: M5-33 NATO NCO Orientation Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M5-33 NATO NCO Orientation Course  have completed over 40 hours comprised of several modules that build upon each other. The topics are first delivered and explained in the classroom, illustrated in examples, exercised in syndicate groups, and finally discussed in plenary classroom. Students are required to produce syndicate work in the form of PowerPoint presentations to confirm the acquirement of delivered knowledge as a part of a formative student assessment.

skills.name: European Atlantic Security Architecture And Non-Military Threats Dangers And Risks To The Alliance
NATO NCO Bi-SC Strategy And NCO Guidelines

aef9d61f-43fd-41b0-bb57-d0f87a4f5266.description: Graduates of this course are senior NATO personnel trusted to formulate plans, policies, advice and strategies based on NATO’s current and future security environment.
aef9d61f-43fd-41b0-bb57-d0f87a4f5266.name: N5-31 NATO Senior Officer Policy Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the N5-31 NATO Senior Officer Policy Course have completed over 40 hours discussing NATO’s security environment and the implications of the current worldwide security situation on NATO policies and plans.

968d2456-5f7c-459e-af7c-3d222e4d756c.description: By having completed this course the graduate has demonstrated the ability to analyze and design an educational and individual training solution which will enable individuals to achieve the performance objectives in accordance with NATO standards. Graduates of this course are also familiar with the NATO Global programming Methodology, Training Needs Analysis and the considerations for developing and implementing materials, services of the E&IT solution in accordance with NATO standards.
968d2456-5f7c-459e-af7c-3d222e4d756c.name: S7-136 NATO Systems Approach to Training

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the this course have completed over 40 hours of study related to applying the NATO SAT processes necessary to produce Course Control Documents (CCDs) to support the delivery of NATO certified E&IT solutions and ensure the deliverables are consistent with BI-SC E&ITD 075-007.

ea6b6d02-fec8-4198-90fc-96822105c771.description: Graduates of this course are prepared with foundational knowledge of the NATO crisis management concept, organization, systems, and procedures as they relate to NATO and PfP officers or their civilian equivalents.
ea6b6d02-fec8-4198-90fc-96822105c771.name: M3-52 NATO Crisis Management Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M3-52 NATO Crisis Management Course have completed over 40 hours lectures, syndicate work, and student presentations focused on creating a baseline understanding of NATO’s crisis management organization and process. Other topics covered are: NATO crisis management system, the roles of other international organizations in crisis management, the NRF concept, crisis response case studies, the legal dimension of crisis management, and syndicate study.

skills.name: Legal Dimension Of NATO Crisis Management And NRF Concept
Nteraction Between NATO Partners And IGOs

af51168d-e901-4a74-848c-6a9f95fa6fbe.description: Graduates of this course are prepared with core foundational knowledge of NATO intelligence, regardless of the core competencies area (CCA) to which they are assigned.
af51168d-e901-4a74-848c-6a9f95fa6fbe.name: N2-02 NATO Intelligence Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the NATO Intelligence Course have completed over 80 hours of study on NATO intelligence and NATO intelligence cycle. The course also focuses on NATO current issues, deficiencies, and transition plans.

skills.name: Collection Step Of The Intelligence Cycle
Direction Step Of The Intelligence Cyclem
Dissemination Step Of The Intelligence Cycle
Processing Step Of The Intelligence Cycle

074c96bc-5293-4199-b545-1a01bdeea6ed.description: Graduates of the M6-109 Network Vulnerability Assessment & Risk Mitigation Course designed and conducted by Naval Postgraduate School at NSO have demonstrated the ability to apply the methods and techniques used for vulnerability assessment and follow on mitigation.
074c96bc-5293-4199-b545-1a01bdeea6ed.name: M6-109 Network Vulnerability Assessment & Risk Mitigation Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M6-109 Network Vulnerability Assessment & Risk Mitigation  Course have completed over 120 hours to exercises, lectures, laboratories, quizzes, tests and discussions related to  mapping of the network, vulnerabilities, and exploits that could be used as threats against NATO networks and possible mitigation strategies.

Students will receive various summative assessments based upon a combination of labs, online quizzes, course participation, and a final project. The weight of these will be as follows: Labs: combined to form 30%; Online weekly quizzes, 30 % total; Class participation, 10 %; Final Project: 30 % write-up.

e6dd4e82-fc55-4f5c-bba9-f9a50ed87fed.description: By having completed this course the graduate has demonstrated the ability to support the implementation and management of NATO Global Programming. The graduate is familiar with the discipline structure used by NATO, the responsibilities of the Requirements Authority and Department Head, and the development methodology used to translate individual and collective training requirements into education and training solutions.
e6dd4e82-fc55-4f5c-bba9-f9a50ed87fed.name: M7-135 NATO Global Programming Analysis Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M7-135 course have completed over 40 hours of study related to managing NATO's Education and Training requirements in Global Programming, as described in BI-SC 75-2 NATO Education and Training (E&T) Directive.

751b4f53-ef0c-430f-ad93-91bd190c726b.description: Graduates of this course are provided with foundational knowledge of NATO's Force Protection concepts and requirements
751b4f53-ef0c-430f-ad93-91bd190c726b.name: P5-40 NATO Force Protection Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the FP orientation course have completed over 40  hours of lectures given by specialists within the whole spectrum of FP and syndicate work in the form of instructor-led discussions and guided questioning during lectures and syndicate.

2a3d903c-7c83-4946-828c-01d87f403233.description: Graduates of this course are prepared to contribute to exercise planning, in accordance with the Bi-SC Collective Training and Exercise Directive 75-3, as an exercise planner or related staff officer.
2a3d903c-7c83-4946-828c-01d87f403233.name: P7-55 NATO Exercise Planning Course (EPC)

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the P7-55 NATO Exercise Planning Course have completed over 40 hours of study related to NATO's exercise planning process combined with practical syndicate work.

skills.name: NATO EDUCATION TRAINING EXERCISE AND EVALUATION (EETE) SYSTEM

a6bf020f-dfbf-4ab4-8147-13e7c738a498.description: Graduates of this course are prepared to increase interoperability and collaboration between NATO and European security agencies while, building confidence and mutual trust among officers and defence civilians of NATO, EU, PfP, Mediterranean Dialogue countries and other OSCE nations.
a6bf020f-dfbf-4ab4-8147-13e7c738a498.name: M5-41 NATO European Security Cooperation Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M5-41 NATO European Security Cooperation Course have successfully completed over 80 hours of study comprised  on formal lectures aimed at the second and third cognitive levels of instruction, panel discussions in support of a preceding formal lecture and  Syndicate work (e.g. guided discussion, problem solving) to consolidate knowledge gained.

a2fb0cbb-d291-4e42-b563-8dedd1644c89.description: By having completed this course the graduate has demonstrated the ability to work as part of a project team in the management, design, development, implementation and evaluation of e-learning solutions for NATO.
a2fb0cbb-d291-4e42-b563-8dedd1644c89.name: S7-126 NATO eLearning Instructional Design Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of this course have completed over 80 hours of coursework online and in residence at NATO School Oberammergau focused on managing, creating, implementing and evaluating e-learning solutions in support of NATO E & IT requirements.

a9390169-d5f0-4bff-a80d-2135f1786b70.description: Graduates of this course are prepared to implement a command security culture aligned with NATO security policies and directives which meet local circumstances and operational requirements.
a9390169-d5f0-4bff-a80d-2135f1786b70.name: N1-38 NATO Security Course

The group exercise culminates in a presentation of the exercise goals and learning objectives.

057d3bb3-4706-49f3-b05e-333f72ec5dc8.description: By having completed this course the graduate has demonstrated the ability to apply the QMS principles, criteria, and standards and develop monitoring and reporting tools to meet NATO Quality Standards for education and training, as outlined in the Bi-SC Directive 75-7 EDUCATION and INDIVIDUAL TRAINING (E&ITD).
057d3bb3-4706-49f3-b05e-333f72ec5dc8.name: S7-137 NATO Quality Assurance Course

8988b7d9-9c35-4dca-87c6-1a793d83621c.description: Graduates of this course are provided with understanding of theater level execution of logistics in NATO operations.
8988b7d9-9c35-4dca-87c6-1a793d83621c.name: M4-160 NATO Logistics Operational Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M4-160  NATO Logistics Operational Course have completed over 40 hours comprised basically of lectures. The students who are not participating on NATO Restricted module will have 77 % lectures and 23 % syndicate work, and will perform student presentations.  The syndicate work consists of analysis of the JOG/AJP 4.6(C), discussions and back briefings having “understanding of the doctrine” as the main objective.

skills.name: C2 Relations Structure And Organization Of The Theatre Level Logistic Support In NATO Operations
Functions And Operation Of The JLSG In The Theatre Level Logistic Support Of NATO Operations
NATO Theatre Level Execution Of Logistics In Article 5 Operations

8db7e8e3-f544-430a-a4da-3bfa27e10fe5.description: Graduates of the M6-111 Network Traffic Analysis course designed and conducted by Naval Postgraduate School at NSO have demonstrated the ability to use analytical methods and techniques to gain deep insight into the operations, use, investigation, and troubleshooting of cyber systems. Earners are now able to analyze packet-switched network traffic at the network layer and solve problems related to traffic engineering and network security.
8db7e8e3-f544-430a-a4da-3bfa27e10fe5.name: M6-111 Network Traffic Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed the 10 week M6-109  Network Vulnerability Assessment & Risk Mitigation Course
Successfully completed the 10 week M6-108  Network Security Course
Successfully completed the 10 week M6-110  Cyber Incident Handling & Disaster Response Course

Graduates of the course need to achieve a combined numeric grade of 70 or better,  based upon assessment cirteria outlined for the hands-on labs exercises, independently completed challenge problems and Distance Learning (DL) analysis problems.

6033e45f-4a14-48fe-a254-2e6934b71056.description: Graduates of this course are prepared to address non-operational, administrative legal issues routinely encountered when working for or with NATO organizations. Graduates are versed in how NATO interacts with other national/international entities, various forms of international arrangements, and the content and practical application of key NATO legal documents.
6033e45f-4a14-48fe-a254-2e6934b71056.name: M5-34 NATO Legal Advisor Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M5-34 NATO Legal Advisor Course have completed over 40 hours of study related to NATO as an international organization, NATO as an international actor, NATO SOFA, privileges, an immunities, and NATO internal & administrative law.

3b074521-2820-4c8f-ac10-b1590df97837.description: Graduates of this course areprepared  with foundational knowledge of NATO EW concepts, organization, technology, and operations
3b074521-2820-4c8f-ac10-b1590df97837.name: N3-21 NATO Joint Electronic Warfare Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the N3-21 NATO Joint Electronic Warfare Course have completed over 40 hours of study  comprised of three modules that build upon each other. Within each module, discrete steps in the process are explained. Conceptual work will be illustrated with EW lessons learned in NATO ops.

skills.name: EW Assets Currently In Use By NATO Forces
EW Concepts Applied To NATO Operations

24a14b5e-0351-4369-b10e-7987cbcc067b.description: By having completed this course the graduate has demonstrated the ability to lead effectively in the NATO environment at the operational level. Graduates of the M1-95 course are prepared to build and lead high performing teams while addressing the myriad of leadership challenges and ethical dilemmas related to leading a multiracial, multicultural, and multigender forces in NATO.
24a14b5e-0351-4369-b10e-7987cbcc067b.name: M1-95 NATO NCO Advanced Leadership Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the NATO Non Commissioned Officer Advanced Leadership Course have completed over 80 hours of study related to applying their leadership skills in a multinational environment.

1fb88d3e-c148-4666-9574-884ba4f86932.description: By having completing this course the graduate able to perform, at an entry level, in a Combined Joint Operations Centre (CJOC) of a NATO-led multinational headquarters.
1fb88d3e-c148-4666-9574-884ba4f86932.name: P3-53 Combined Joint Operations Centre Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the CJOC Course have completed over 40 hours of lectures, syndicate work, and student presentations. The course focuses on creating a baseline understanding of the common missions and major functions of the CJOC within a NATO-led multinational headquarters, the general differences between CJOCs, functioning at the strategic, operational, and tactical levels, and the activities performed by the CJOC of a NATO-led multinational headquarters.

skills.name: CJOC SOPs To A CJOC Model

aae7439f-9306-4db7-8e47-09f03958de7b.description: Graduates of this course are prepared to provide guidance and advice to NATO and PfP commanders on current NATO public affairs policy, procedures, and activities.

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M5-46 NATO Public Affairs Policy Indoctrination Course have completed over 40 hours of interactive plenary lectures, followed by briefs, moderated Q&A sessions. Case studies complete the subject matter.

87cf35ee-43c6-4747-99b7-361cf61308ca.description: By having completed this course the graduate has demonstrated the ability to work with an experimentation team in refining a concept using a valid experimental set up, determine the conditions for a “valid” experiment, setting up an experimentation team, executing the experiment, and refining the concept based on results of the experimentation. A successful graduate of this course will also be able to to determine the CD&E inputs required for the capability development process.
87cf35ee-43c6-4747-99b7-361cf61308ca.name: M7-51 NATO Concept Development and Experimentation Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M7-51 NATO Concept Development and Experimentation course have completed over 40 hours of study related to NATO's concept development, experimentation structure, and processes.

0043d9ae-567c-4ff3-94d9-a7df8f6360e8.description: By having completing this course the graduate are prepared for the role of Alternative Analysis Facilitator.
0043d9ae-567c-4ff3-94d9-a7df8f6360e8.name: P5-129 NATO Alternative Analysis Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the P5-129 NATO Alternative Analysis Course have completed over 40 hours,of interactive plenary lectures, followed by brief, moderated Q&A sessions alternating with facilitated work in small syndicates. Case studies and scenarios are also considered to identify best practice and lessons identified.

skills.name: NATO Alternative Analysis Capability And Theory
Roles And Interactions Of AltA Facilitators
The Four Phases Of AltA Process

3778ff4f-fa12-44c8-b25d-5ac0d42b10e1.description: Graduates of this course are provided with fundamental medical support planning knowledge for medical support planner's appointed to NATO-Multinational Headquarters or as national medical support planners that interact with the NATO Command structure.

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the NATO Joint Medical Planner Course (JMPC) Course have completed 40 hours of lectures and syndicate work which result in syndicate presentations. Topics includes:  overview of NATO structures and its operational and medical support planning processes;  NATO comprehensive operational planning directive (COPD) and the NATO operational planning process (OPP) with an emphasis on how Medical Support planning contributes to them; Supporting operations in different environments;.

skills.name: Multinational Aspects Of Medical Support Applications
NATO Medical Command And Control Structures

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M4-92 Movement and Logistics Operational Planning Course have completed over 40 hours of lectures, syndicate work, and student presentations. The Crisis in the Zoran Sea Scenario provides the backdrop against which students conduct the NATO operational planning process as members of an operational-level DCOS support logistics plans group. The operational planning process as driven by the COPD ver 2.0 is conducted from Phase 1 through Phase 3B with a lecture and guided discussion

skills.name: NATO Operational Logistics And Movement Planning

a9b645e2-5e3c-49c2-b752-e62089b29360.description: Graduates of the M6-110 Cyber Incident Handling & Disaster Response Course designed and conducted by Naval Postgraduate School at NSO have demonstrated the ability to address the nature and scope of cyber security incident handling services, including intrusion/incident detection, damage control, service continuity, forensic analysis, service/data restoration, and incident reporting.
a9b645e2-5e3c-49c2-b752-e62089b29360.name: M6-110 Cyber Incident Handling & Disaster Response Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the M6-110 Cyber Incident Handling & Disaster Response Course have completed over 120 hours to exercises, lectures, laboratories, quizzes, tests and discussions related to  cyber security incident handling services, including intrusion/incident detection, damage control, service continuity, forensic analysis, service/data restoration, and incident reporting.

Students will be assessed based upon a combination of labs, quizzes, and two additional exams. The weight of these will be as follows: Submitted Labs: 30%; Quizzes: 30 %; EC-Council Disaster Recovery Professional (DRP) exam: 15%; and EC-Council Cyber Incident Handler (CIH) exam: 25%

d6d148e9-a3b8-4926-9214-c75757b33b63.description: By having completed this course the graduate has demonstrated the ability to support the implementation of NATO CBRN Defence policy in accordance with NATO doctrine and standardization agreements. d6d148e9-a3b8-4926-9214-c75757b33b63.name: M3-70 NATO CBRN Defence Orientation Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the NATO CBRN Defence Orientation  course have completed over 40 hours of  exchange of information and experience related to CBRN Defence within the NATO Alliance. Syndicate exercises and an off-site trip are conducted to reinforce learning objectives and facilitate student collaboration.

6e001761-8b59-4560-8209-e9bdc880098d.description: Graduates of this course are prepared with foundational knowledge of the principles of the NATO movement planning and execution process.
6e001761-8b59-4560-8209-e9bdc880098d.name: M4-14 NATO Movement Course

05a1b984-5581-4d09-9abb-297900f2320e.name: M4-93 NATO Host Nation Support Course

Days 4 and 5 focus on the practical application of the doctrinal aspects on a given scenario.

3262d9d5-d2df-435a-8d83-bf4b7de70396.name: N3-19 NATO Information Operations Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the N3-19 NATO Information Operations Course Course have completed over 80 hours of study related to INFO OPS planning exercises introduced by classroom lectures and followed by intense mentor-guided work in small syndicates, followed by back briefs to plenary.

de2064e5-1187-46e4-9489-b2b04c91594f.description: Graduates of this course are prepared with foundational knowledge of NATO logistics policy, principles, concepts, and doctrine of theatre-level logistics in operations.
de2064e5-1187-46e4-9489-b2b04c91594f.name: M4-94 NATO Logistics Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the have completed over 80 hours of lectures, syndicate work, and student presentations. Due to the huge amount of information, 80% of the course consists on central presentations/lectures held by supporting speakers. The syndicate work consists on analysis of the main logistic doctrines, discussions and back briefings having “understanding of the doctrine” as the main objective.

7eb14932-5e68-4129-a738-0d3cc90e48f9.description: Graduates of this course are prepared  to analyse Electronic Warfare related factors in an Operational Setting and to design a basic Electronic Warfare OPLAN.
7eb14932-5e68-4129-a738-0d3cc90e48f9.name: N3-22 NATO Electronic Warfare (EW) Operational Planning Course

badge_template_activities.title: Graduates of the N3-22 NATO Electronic Warfare (EW) Operational Planning Course have completed over 40 hours of interactive plenary lectures, followed by brief moderated Q&A sessions and syndicate work.
